emails.subject: {Case#80026785} ## : High - P2 - Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Thank you for contacting Westcon Technical Support. This email is in regard 
to your Westcon support case 80026785 - Is management via API possible in 
WEB VPM?

The case has been assigned and the engineer is working on it. You will 
receive an update soon after the engineer reviewed the case.

Feel free to respond to this email or update in the case comment should you 
want to follow up the progress.

Please click here to see the full details of the case: 80026785
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvpoJIRZ181egumZrKbs0-2FynXKclx0v0c3WSTsBnUkFppJoTNH0-2B08SfPV9SC4So5tau6RsY5VsOIkkZy2ykSL72wLVZyv-2BqCBHpyO9ivOKc-2Fh5L3KTX8oXpqfPWi9x8IfA-3D-3DmQs5_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2F4oifRpgj3GzTYxFNd7y4X-2Bkaunx8bmZS1JemaJmkiXrXchx9HPHbuBmz7sX4fHMGd2gyHHKfSc0PHD3n0iAHoNuAt9VmFPgjh8RWfdFuyRtRJvufu7y4o7cf1J64NChFRgEtwktBTNmjfm89z4b4RID9-2FOa9EdZKdp5YPfxZCcs-3D>

Thank you.

Regards,
Westcon Technical Support (Broadcom)

emails.subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or 
integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.

Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqqOBWmPnfbCakTP9QrLCzMJxPkIAVSKW-2FS9kt6Xk3R94-3DvnoK_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FCwDNCnact-2FViKu1EfvDbvsQWqc7k4QzQ-2F9kEnELALrsimPW-2BpmMp-2FeJG5Q-2FY8QgW3zBBLjxApE43wplNpNlpw9UUxM9JSnXYSpgHclv5ZDCtjl66bsry1lETy1RXhsfCVvXhU2CRc8S4g3g-2BgER4iQqYsx21Dq-2BZ4T2-2FeXjeVGY-3D>

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like 
https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3D4vpv_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FCwDNCnact-2FViKu1EfvDbvnic6eIFWSs7gxrfYMrR-2FvScTevni8tyc85nzt4MbVdHVcn3Zaj-2BWndouG1s2BlLHUXbsibcx16A51UGilcTu-2Fyn4UalaXUQmM0igJw8MkeCKTi5I7rNUYxnaLI1Fj-2FnXw5359v48ry3HkapLOFklCg-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or 
https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DPL1g_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FCwDNCnact-2FViKu1EfvDbvtYaF-2B5GEeaEwTeT2ocfcfG2QJgo5Mvz519Py97E-2F0gcF8FcKqUc76bLVRYZ8nYo66hgJa5lBqR3Vxh8PPMMg4FVb1EAucfjzw2JeViDseFmGDeY-2FMAgyg-2BBSHnBR6VRweOtoOTxHbRTWmD6A-2B-2FRwDg-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the 
proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy 
configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands 
for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqea8dssjNXunRCJq4bwX3t5BhAmpJ3tCz2NlUwBWVPNsj0oWH3rOI1k0jU-2FJgQBg7laNH_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FCwDNCnact-2FViKu1EfvDbvipNhqFlXUFtXzdsYHJ-2BoHevasrcJfeCt-2BBejX9Y29-2B4IU36zimvcjr2QQS9xZ2wby04ticp9CQL4eHnVU8bVMccsjd-2FRhU2C7iZ338N8Gi5J8Ntym55zLgvUCWMJ-2FzuL1fsKvU7V-2BRgsN4YyYRQsLc-3D>

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvnDc8K3x600YbURrRAC-2BT-2FBuAtdmNOGYNvQk31xRrmIAc-2FLgRBrp677GG24jtnw-2F3D5lVkBJhEP1fKoqkmTq-2FIIXP0WmS7PSLP6jWuyfnn-2FNS1ZXpbtcJRcay4UHIUiVog-3D-3DiSej_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FCwDNCnact-2FViKu1EfvDbvnuBTw8dR0BEsgxjm4UH4nMYI8LIp5zYKcottDJEjaCp8ekuQDlr3ZtKvFZKR7IQ6i9Rpl88AhIWKiYWhAwrdtnFbtcPtQsffUJjfc9hmxTnieLRLZIXw2hg55zntDnh-2BaHBUrsPTNTap5aD-2BUIKv-2Fs-3D>

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in 
WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel 
format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is 
structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and 
MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, 
authentication and access with different format and function, it almost 
impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and 
column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi, Team

Thank you for your support.

I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a case because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are impossible.
Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?
Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM
To: kevin@etechsystem.co..kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

emails.subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
Hi Jinyoung Hong, I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below are the answer: Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? -For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now. Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API? -For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. * Access and raise alerts. * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables. * View jobs and job execution status. * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs. * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device. * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts. * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device. * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors. Regards, Fauzee Hi Jinyoung Hong, Please give me some time to check this with Broadcom documentation. I will update you once I found the related answer. Regards, Fauzee NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi Jinyoung Hong,


I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.


Regards,
Fauzee

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Please give me some time to check this with Broadcom documentation. I will update you once I found the related answer.

Regards,
Fauzee

Q1) Is it possible to export policies in Excel format instead of XML format and install them in Excel format?

QQ2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through MC,

but is it possible to operate it with only the currently provided REST API as in VPM? Please answer with this focus.

 

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 3:06 PM
To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport..apac@westcon.com
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,


I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.


Regards,
Fauzee

Please give me some time to check this with Broadcom documentation. I will update you once I found the related answer..

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi, Team

Thank you for your support.

I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a case because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are impossible.
Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?
Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM
To: kevin@etechsystem.co..kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi, Team

 

I think I didn't convey the meaning of my question properly, so I'll summarize it and send it to you again.

I need a clear answer because I need to convey the information to the customer.

 

Q1) When managing policies through policy management via REST API,

Can I manage all policies without even running VPM?

 

This part is very important.

Currently, I want to know whether all functions in VPM, such as rule modification and layer management,

can be managed through REST API.

 

Q2) Currently, it is not possible to reflect policies on Excel, and there are no plans to improve this function in the future. Is that correct?

 

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2025 6:49 PM
To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,


I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.


Regards,
Fauzee

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]

To: kevin@etechsystem.co.kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem..co.kr
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. Regards, Fauzee [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] [image.png]

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2025 6:49 PM
To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

  • Access and raise alerts.

  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.

Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi, Team

 

I think I didn't convey the meaning of my question properly, so I'll summarize it and send it to you again.

I need a clear answer because I need to convey the information to the customer.

 

Q1) When managing policies through policy management via REST API,

Can I manage all policies without even running VPM?

 

This part is very important.

Currently, I want to know whether all functions in VPM, such as rule modification and layer management,

can be managed through REST API.

 

Q2) Currently, it is not possible to reflect policies on Excel, and there are no plans to improve this function in the future. Is that correct?

 

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2025 6:49 PM
To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.


Regards,
Fauzee

Thank you for your support.

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com]
Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM
To: kevin@etechsystem.co.kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Q2) Currently, it is not possible to reflect policies on Excel, and there are no plans to improve this function in the future. Is that correct?

(Answer)-Yes that is correct. There no plan to improve this in the near future.

Regards,

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

emails.body:
Hi Team, The way the REST API function is never meant to replace the VPM ease of use. User need to know all the syntax of the REST API function and additionally the syntax of the proxysg cpl line. What you're looking for is policy manager to manage the policy without using web VPM like java based in previous version. And unfortunately this is not supported on web based console. Please contact SE to raise feature request for this feature. Regards, Fauzee NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi, Team [image.png] Is VPM not possible in the Content Type section? The customer is wondering if it is possible to manage or convert all functions including objects and rules currently used in VPM and automate them through API. I think this is quite cumbersome and difficult, and I don't know if it is possible. The number of objects will be in the thousands to tens of thousands, and the number of rules will also be in the tens of thousands. So a careful answer is needed. All functions performed in VPM should be possible through REST API. Regards, [image.png] From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Tuesday, April 22, 2025 1:43 PM To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM? From your previous email, with picture post the policy, i notice there is status of 400 Bad Request. On further below, we can see the bad request are due to the content type used is VPM. While in the example in api content type used is application/json. Maybe you can try to change that. Regards, Fauzee NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. If it is a part that can be currently supported in MC REST API, an example and confirmation are needed, and if it is not possible through REST API, an FR request is being made. Hi Team, Please refer below for the answer: Q1) When managing policies through policy management via REST API, Can I manage all policies without even running VPM? This part is very important. Currently, I want to know whether all functions in VPM, such as rule modification and layer management,can be managed through REST API. (Answer)-Yes you can manage all function in vpm via REST API.. Q2) Currently, it is not possible to reflect policies on Excel, and there are no plans to improve this function in the future. Is that correct? (Answer)-Yes that is correct. There no plan to improve this in the near future. Regards, Fauzee NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi, Team I think I didn't convey the meaning of my question properly, so I'll summarize it and send it to you again. I need a clear answer because I need to convey the information to the customer. Q1) When managing policies through policy management via REST API, Can I manage all policies without even running VPM? This part is very important. Currently, I want to know whether all functions in VPM, such as rule modification and layer management, can be managed through REST API. Q2) Currently, it is not possible to reflect policies on Excel, and there are no plans to improve this function in the future. Is that correct? Regards, [image.png] From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2025 6:49 PM To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM? Hi Team, Please refer below for my answer. (Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API. For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM. (A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to: * Access and raise alerts. * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables. * View jobs and job execution status. * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs. * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device. * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts. * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device. * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors. Please refer below KB for more information on REST API. Management Center REST API (Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel. Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel. (A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now. Regard, Fauzee NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi, Team You said that you will not provide Proxy API in the future, I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API. For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM. Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel. Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel. Regards, [image.png] From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Thursday, April 17, 2025 4:00 PM To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM? Hi Team, For the question below: QQ2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through MC, but is it possible to operate it with only the currently provided REST API as in VPM? Please answer with this focus. REST API are only working on Management Center, you can create script to make management center to create policy/object and push the policy install to the proxy device. It does not directly interact with VPM in proxy. Regards, Fauzee NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi, Team Q1) Is it possible to export policies in Excel format instead of XML format and install them in Excel format? QQ2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through MC,2) I have another question. You said that you can create new objects, change policy contents, etc. through MC, but is it possible to operate it with only the currently provided REST API as in VPM? Please answer with this focus. Regards, [image.png] From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Wednesday, April 16, 2025 3:06 PM To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM? Hi Jinyoung Hong, I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below are the answer: Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? -For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future -For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now. Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API? -For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. * Access and raise alerts. * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables. * View jobs and job execution status. * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs. * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device. * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts. * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device. * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors. Regards, Fauzee Hi Jinyoung Hong, Please give me some time to check this with Broadcom documentation. I will update you once I found the related answer. Regards, Fauzee NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button. Hi, Team Thank you for your support. I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a case because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are impossible. Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future? Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API? Regards, [image.png] From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM To: kevin@etechsystem.co.kr Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM? Hi Jinyoung Hong, Regarding your question please refer below for the answer: Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM. Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM? The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products. Workaround : 1. Use the Management Center REST API. Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API 2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3D1G2P_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2F7O1Eu4nz5PYQTv1KryIcXdnhos3mdbb5Yszy2J0kZocAaHCC-2BqkUdP3cRSWYrXgHEs5gkAUMcOCJYylN1dfEUbw3rsm4DfBj-2BPO9y7Q6ipoTFmiBh7dETan-2BAnM67uPNPGyJA-2F6HD2i9LdjBDB-2FBeqaI89SbvkGnypu0t7INIK8-3D:8082/sysinfo or https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DeH8n_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2F7O1Eu4nz5PYQTv1KryIcXemi8daqBzEqvoMgPHxMAjOozKsV8iHem6R8XVfHCipScWFogDt-2FcEeANfS1QwHHCOTZYN3cd8vmItMPKekb7IJK4XiZyFo68rZUp6FDjWpKl1boOih2n1ZPXbhq2oFyM562pzpNxcHKT6t8maGFRIM-3D:8082/policy/ These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM? Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. Regards, Fauzee [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] [image.png] [image.png]

Hi Team,

The way the REST API function is never meant to replace the VPM ease of use. User need to know all the syntax of the REST API function and additionally the syntax of the proxysg cpl line. 

What you're looking for is policy manager to manage the policy without using web VPM like java based in previous version. And unfortunately this is not supported on web based console.

Please contact SE to raise feature request for this feature. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

  • Access and raise alerts.
  • View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.
  • View jobs and job execution status.
  • Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
  • Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.
  • Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
  • Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.
  • Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.


Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi, Team

Thank you for your support.

I was thinking the same thing about the contents, but I opened a case because of the customer's request. For now, I understand that both are impossible.
Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?
Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com <mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com>  [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] 
Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM
To: kevin@etechsystem.co.kr <mailto:kevin@etechsystem.co.kr> 
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr <mailto:symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr> 
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.

Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html> 

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https:// <https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/sysinfo> <ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https:// <https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/policy/> <ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html> 

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products <https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html> 

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Use the Management Center REST API.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US><br>Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>See the documentation on the REST API: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html" title="Management Center REST API">Management Center REST API</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US> <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like <a href="https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/sysinfo">https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo</a> or <a href="https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/policy/">https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/</a> <br><br>These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US> <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>Refer to the CLI documentation: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html">ProxySG Command Line Reference</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span lang=EN-US><a href="https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html">ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products</a><br><br></span><strong><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:"Poppins",serif;background:white'>Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?</span></strong><b><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:"Poppins",serif;background:white'><br><br></span></b><span lang=EN-US>Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

*	Access and raise alerts.

*	View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.

*	View jobs and job execution status.

*	Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.

*	Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.

*	Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.

*	Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.

*	Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/4-1/api.html>  API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel. 

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

*	Access and raise alerts.

*	View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.

*	View jobs and job execution status.

*	Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.

*	Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.

*	Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.

*	Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.

*	Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Regards,
Fauzee

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?
Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com <mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com>  [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] 
Sent: Monday, April 14, 2025 3:58 PM

Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr <mailto:symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr> 
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.

Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html> 

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like https:// <https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/sysinfo> <ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or https:// <https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/policy/> <ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html> 

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products <https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html> 

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,

lang=EN-US> <o:p></o:p></span></p><div><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span lang=EN-US>Hi Jinyoung Hong,<br><br>Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:<br><br></span><strong><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins;background:white'>Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.</span></strong><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins'><br><strong><span style='font-family:Poppins;background:white'>Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?</span></strong></span><span lang=EN-US><o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>Workaround : <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>1. Use the Management Center REST API.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US><br>Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>See the documentation on the REST API: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html" title="Management Center REST API">Management Center REST API</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US> <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like <a href="https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/sysinfo">https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo</a> or <a href="https://%3cProxySG_IP_address%3e:8082/policy/">https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/</a> <br><br>These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US> <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>Refer to the CLI documentation: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html">ProxySG Command Line Reference</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span lang=EN-US><a href="https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html">ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products</a><br><br></span><strong><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins;background:white'>Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?</span></strong><b><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins;background:white'><br><br></span></b><span lang=EN-US>Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. <br><br>Regards,<br>Fauzee<o:p></o:p></span></p></div><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span lang=EN-US style='border:solid windowtext emails.subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
Hi Team,

I already inform SE team regarding this issue. The main point is that :
1. Currently proxysg do not support API, 
2. And it also do not support policy export to excel
3. The only way for scripting to be used is using REST API in Management 
Center.

For the REST API we can only provide the documentation and not the 
scripting for user. 

For feature request this will go to SE team to request to Broadcom. 

Since the main question has been answered, I will proceed to close this 
ticket. For the FR please contact the SE team for more information.

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi Team,

The way the REST API function is never meant to replace the VPM ease of 
use. User need to know all the syntax of the REST API function and 
additionally the syntax of the proxysg cpl line. 

What you're looking for is policy manager to manage the policy without 
using web VPM like java based in previous version. And unfortunately this 
is not supported on web based console.

Please contact SE to raise feature request for this feature. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is 
management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when 
using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for 
the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through 
REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without 
using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using 
the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

    * Access and raise alerts.
    * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring
      variables.
    * View jobs and job execution status.
    * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
    * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of
      device.
    * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
    * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy
      content, and installing policy on a device.
    * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqqOBWmPnfbCakTP9QrLCzMNLjIkY0ZMWalF-2BMEykO62k-3Dp21r_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FdrHaiWODL2Ec32N7-2Fzsx6MazQDfqSCoj-2F-2F3ovp5tL1o7ARdmVBjr54tZ3K444-2BaWwg3-2B0cRczaq8kRBL8X5Qx932zn56aSH9QOnIaqoBs31MR1FbeuAqJxpvxMvncxaPeEM5Jevht8VWAWacnp77KXPg0Tl7e8Wne3X3f4bEL1s-3D>

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it 
is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel 
format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is 
structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and 
MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, 
authentication and access with different format and function, it almost 
impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and 
column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this 
feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below 
are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the 
future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this 
feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects 
possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be 
managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required 
the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

    * Access and raise alerts.
    * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring
      variables.
    * View jobs and job execution status.
    * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
    * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of
      device.
    * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
    * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy
      content, and installing policy on a device.
    * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or 
integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.

Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqqOBWmPnfbCakTP9QrLCzMJxPkIAVSKW-2FS9kt6Xk3R94-3DiZWK_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FdrHaiWODL2Ec32N7-2Fzsx6IC5PFl-2Bz3OecxaRg1aOYHevxZuFDX5i2xLod2SBZ6JI7G38FZL-2FwewigHQ42ycmBcRfqbHnJzmdaL3ut0t-2B03EhqZ0s1YxSYNez3LLMI4aUtuJtIKvBTtE8Via2p7RLtV0KM1SXZgqXurgsc-2BvjyHU-3D>

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like 
https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DYsed_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FdrHaiWODL2Ec32N7-2Fzsx6BsdQIRU98rKoytI2FIdJot6t6bFSIbXIUoJVZwZV8XYz2qB67jKBHzvROUjJku3xHy4zifxWw8KZ6eb5TEIqUu-2FuKqaf41QxZSLEujU050vaJ-2Fh2LQeTCxXuZ6M8iF8JsG11hge2t0A9y3-2FeYLT2KY-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or 
https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DXhap_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FdrHaiWODL2Ec32N7-2Fzsx6IBXYBDRgm4CASR21cqjE6nCRvGrKpwKxzMjrcTaKfDG-2BZHtkVfsZWfjV1tJC3Hk961zcePYtOK2ZrUpbZIcfqdKzMLE5NdsYX4jH-2FalNBIs-2Ff2xx-2BaHtUYnGomFD1Or65BoaZud8qC89Qct1rD4u4w-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the 
proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy 
configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands 
for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqea8dssjNXunRCJq4bwX3t5BhAmpJ3tCz2NlUwBWVPNsj0oWH3rOI1k0jU-2FJgQBg78Co2_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FdrHaiWODL2Ec32N7-2Fzsx6O-2FxIL1LFG2Mr3I9JUbgKhcC69OxuKyRRU38K-2B5sVrOY0iJejmq8TBNVGBrnwgwjaI6IDMmAy6Xp5ZYjU5IZ-2FyWE0j17nzfB0quV7my58lLThLFRN8yFLIrnJgVvQjagvs-2F1KUmvjw-2Bkv-2FQLanFouis-3D>

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvnDc8K3x600YbURrRAC-2BT-2FBuAtdmNOGYNvQk31xRrmIAc-2FLgRBrp677GG24jtnw-2F3D5lVkBJhEP1fKoqkmTq-2FIIXP0WmS7PSLP6jWuyfnn-2FNS1ZXpbtcJRcay4UHIUiVog-3D-3D5SNE_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FdrHaiWODL2Ec32N7-2Fzsx6Gt5DIGhZLGPytborZpSuFbjkXbiHxMSn5BCLG9PUUH9LZWUXV4-2Bl0WH3jZZZyDoBpO8VY7g-2FoFAsVnU5srj7tRjtSSLzI94MJiY2U-2FeUnMfwQB-2FUi7PF2xXAmCPZyjMwXkkFzZCx1vI29Be4kpz0Zg-3D>

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in 
WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel 
format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is 
structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and 
MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, 
authentication and access with different format and function, it almost 
impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and 
column. 

Regards,
Fauzee
