mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;">Hi Jinyoung Hong,<br><br>Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:<br><br><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.</span></strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins;"><br><strong><span style="font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?</span></strong></span></p><p>The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.</p><p>Workaround : </p><p>1. Use the Management Center REST API.</p><p><br>Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. </p><p>See the documentation on the REST API: <a title="Management Center REST API" href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html" clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off">Management Center REST API</a></p><p> </p><p>2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like <a href="https://<ProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off">:8082/sysinfo"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo</a> or <a href="https://<ProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off">:8082/policy/"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/</a> <br><br>These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. </p><p> </p><p>3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. </p><p>Refer to the CLI documentation: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html" clicktracking="off">ProxySG Command Line Reference</a></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;"><a href="https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate..html" clicktracking="off">ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products</a><br><br><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?</span></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;"><br><br></span></strong>Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. <br><br>Regards,<br>Fauzee</p></div><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto; emails.subject: RE: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?
emails.body:
charset="utf-8"

Hi, Team

 

How do I request FR from the SE team?

 

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] 
Sent: Friday, May 2, 2025 11:29 AM
To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

I already inform SE team regarding this issue. The main point is that :
1. Currently proxysg do not support API, 
2. And it also do not support policy export to excel
3. The only way for scripting to be used is using REST API in Management Center.

For the REST API we can only provide the documentation and not the scripting for user. 

For feature request this will go to SE team to request to Broadcom. 

Since the main question has been answered, I will proceed to close this ticket. For the FR please contact the SE team for more information.

Regards,
Fauzee

  _____

If so, the customer would like to know how to automate it through Policy.xml in the current way.

 

Can you help me with this?

 

Regards,

 

 

 

 

 

From: broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com <mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com>  [mailto:broadcomsupport@apaccms.westcon.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, April 22, 2025 3:49 PM
To: dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr <mailto:dsp0701@etechsystem.co.kr> ; kevin@etechsystem.co.kr <mailto:kevin@etechsystem.co.kr> 
Cc: symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr <mailto:symantec-blue@etechsystem.co.kr> ; broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com <mailto:broadcomsupport.apac@westcon.com> 
Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

The way the REST API function is never meant to replace the VPM ease of use. User need to know all the syntax of the REST API function and additionally the syntax of the proxysg cpl line. 

What you're looking for is policy manager to manage the policy without using web VPM like java based in previous version. And unfortunately this is not supported on web based console.

Please contact SE to raise feature request for this feature. 

Regards,
Fauzee

 

 

NOTE: This email was received from an external source. If there is anything suspicious or unusual about this email please DO NOT open any attachments or click any links and report the email using the Report Message button.

 

Hi, Team

 

 

Is VPM not possible in the Content Type section?

 

The customer is wondering if it is possible to manage or convert all functions including objects and rules currently used in VPM and automate them through API.

 

I think this is quite cumbersome and difficult,

and I don't know if it is possible.

The number of objects will be in the thousands to tens of thousands,

and the number of rules will also be in the tens of thousands.

 

So a careful answer is needed.

All functions performed in VPM should be possible through REST API.

 

Regards,

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

In the attachment i included an api documentation, for reference. Only the list of parameter in the API documentation are supported. From your previous email, with picture post the policy, i notice there is status of 400 Bad Request. On further below, we can see the bad request are due to the content type used is VPM. While in the example in api content type used is application/json. Maybe you can try to change that. 

Regards,
Fauzee

How can I use POST for the policy currently registered in MC?

and if it is not possible through REST API, an FR request is being made.

 

Regards,

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

*	Access and raise alerts.

*	View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.

*	View jobs and job execution status.

*	Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.

*	Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.

*	Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.

*	Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.

*	Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/4-1/api.html>  API

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel. 

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

*	Access and raise alerts.

*	View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring variables.

*	View jobs and job execution status.

*	Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.

*	Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of device.

*	Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.

*	Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy content, and installing policy on a device.

*	Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Regards,
Fauzee

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.

Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html> 

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like :8082/sysinfo <https://%3cProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=> "> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or :8082/policy/ <https://%3cProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=> "> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference <https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html> 

ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products <https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html> 

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

below for the answer:<br><br></span><strong><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins;background:white'>Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.</span></strong><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins'><br><strong><span style='font-family:Poppins;background:white'>Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?</span></strong></span><span lang=EN-US><o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>Workaround : <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>1. Use the Management Center REST API.<o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US><br>Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>See the documentation on the REST API: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html" title="Management Center REST API">Management Center REST API</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US> <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like <a href="https://%3cProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=">:8082/sysinfo"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo</a> or <a href="https://%3cProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=">:8082/policy/"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/</a> <br><br>These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US> <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. <o:p></o:p></span></p><p><span lang=EN-US>Refer to the CLI documentation: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html">ProxySG Command Line Reference</a><o:p></o:p></span></p><p class=MsoNormal style='mso-margin-top-alt:auto;mso-margin-bottom-alt:auto'><span lang=EN-US><a href="https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html">ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products</a><br><br></span><strong><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins;background:white'>Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?</span></strong><b><span lang=EN-US style='font-size:10.5pt;font-family:Poppins;background:white'><br><br></span></b><span lang=EN-US>Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and Hi Team,

In the email to SE Team, Mr. Sangdae Kim reply saying that if customer

Hi Team,

I already inform SE team regarding this issue. The main point is that :
1. Currently proxysg do not support API, 
2. And it also do not support policy export to excel
3. The only way for scripting to be used is using REST API in Management 
Center.

For the REST API we can only provide the documentation and not the 
scripting for user. 

For feature request this will go to SE team to request to Broadcom. 

Since the main question has been answered, I will proceed to close this 
ticket. For the FR please contact the SE team for more information.

Regards,
Fauzee

Hi Team,

The way the REST API function is never meant to replace the VPM ease of 
use. User need to know all the syntax of the REST API function and 
additionally the syntax of the proxysg cpl line. 

What you're looking for is policy manager to manage the policy without 
using web VPM like java based in previous version. And unfortunately this 
is not supported on web based console.

Please contact SE to raise feature request for this feature. 

Regards,
Fauzee

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is 
management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when 
using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for 
the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through 
REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without 
using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using 
the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

    * Access and raise alerts.
    * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring
      variables.
    * View jobs and job execution status.
    * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
    * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of
      device.
    * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
    * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy
      content, and installing policy on a device.
    * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqqOBWmPnfbCakTP9QrLCzMNLjIkY0ZMWalF-2BMEykO62k-3DqF-M_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FwjVlURAhmpBuLzQBGK6-2BCalr-2Bla3jNoDfvb5qom3Uh2nYXenibVmI4pgPmOCZ6n4YziRwlnI0Wckuo7Zm6Qt0g6OVfFAcYAxdDgbOVR01KPLb77k2VqpcOIuMEq6iDz-2BxYnxdbDFfkLMWYXXOJXQIRlU5h30vQ3LJCjqRQVBAXc-3D>

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it 
is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel 
format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is 
structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and 
MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, 
authentication and access with different format and function, it almost 
impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and 
column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this 
feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

I have check with Broadcom Engineer regarding the question below and below 
are the answer:

Q1) Are there any plans to support these in the future?

-For ProxySG web API, there are no plan to support this feature in the 
future

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this 
feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Q2) Aren't only simple tasks such as creating and modifying objects 
possible through REST API in MC? Can all the functions provided by VPM be 
managed through REST API?

-For REST API, you can use it to do below function, however this required 
the proxy to be connected to the Management Center. 

    * Access and raise alerts.
    * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring
      variables.
    * View jobs and job execution status.
    * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
    * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of
      device.
    * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
    * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy
      content, and installing policy on a device.
    * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Regards,
Fauzee

Fauzee

Subject: {Case#80026785} ##High - P2 - SAMSUNG ELECTRONICS CO,.LTD-Is 
management via API possible in WEB VPM?

 

Hi Jinyoung Hong,

Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or 
integrate with third-party products.

Workaround : 

1. Use the Management Center REST API.

Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. 

See the documentation on the REST API: Management Center REST API
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqqOBWmPnfbCakTP9QrLCzMJxPkIAVSKW-2FS9kt6Xk3R94-3DcYJP_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FwjVlURAhmpBuLzQBGK6-2BCVH-2BNtQWu2Kbyg93741QPdUxQwr-2BJDAk3OiWwhMsVi96-2FUEJrP4Ewsh4JbvhRsqahU0SB5KwCyYm-2B-2FhUxMOOtE2yG4KXMaXpALKXpWNDEzn-2FkB2RZxiEvwrpwCPGr79BqZVAZcnqm-2FUZ94BSLD3VdIs-3D>

 

2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like :8082/sysinfo"> 
https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DaRGA_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FwjVlURAhmpBuLzQBGK6-2BCacBbO0ZEMVOzh2NxiR-2BIxRjuj4GjEc6FtJYz4r1rq-2FD1v06jrrj2OgS9fPu-2FoyMBefqKl6wXcM5-2FCMf34YzmdNGWQ8z9iQmYmsz3Y-2FIGtYUvDCnTXI868S03QSLZ-2FTz7kPGmv0t1HQsDCIeoRJ0YR4-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or :8082/policy/"> 
https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DPg5j_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FwjVlURAhmpBuLzQBGK6-2BCeApcPRVu-2BPikReK0XQ2jfwNQyA2t7fXiWup-2FktLKJDz80cjqylVi98RBX6MOUwYAoDSoEEYXaXD9V55r-2BoUKtftkAgM0pZ9Xf6pLe-2B-2BqAJReh6t6GyDuEN9fwGsZ-2BgOUKukX9jN-2BLpr-2Bj-2FCNsrFSJc-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/ 

These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the 
proxy. 

 

3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy 
configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands 
for automation. 

Refer to the CLI documentation: ProxySG Command Line Reference
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqea8dssjNXunRCJq4bwX3t5BhAmpJ3tCz2NlUwBWVPNsj0oWH3rOI1k0jU-2FJgQBg78-nD_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FwjVlURAhmpBuLzQBGK6-2BCbfqj6yqFYLcJ89XvEKfQulCOmLbhbg75aU9nyqeS2MNngjkCeoBiz0bhgyuQzXmNtf4KpGHRWi2sRiKLZieEZMJbRiGzXDklOkjbyx5L-2FqzDwYpmHGgkAk1cIpB8rsOdfiFroWrzAmPM5-2BQDMSJjMI-3D>

Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in 
WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel 
format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is 
structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and 
MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, 
authentication and access with different format and function, it almost 
impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and 
column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;">Hi Jinyoung Hong,<br><br>Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:<br><br><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.</span></strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins;"><br><strong><span style="font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?</span></strong></span></p><p>The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.</p><p>Workaround : </p><p>1. Use the Management Center REST API.</p><p><br>Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. </p><p>See the documentation on the REST API: <a title="Management Center REST API" href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html" clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off">Management Center REST API</a></p><p> </p><p>2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like <a href="https://<ProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=" clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off"> :8082/sysinfo"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo</a> or <a href="https://<ProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=" clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off"> :8082/policy/"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/</a> <br><br>These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. </p><p> </p><p>3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation. </p><p>Refer to the CLI documentation: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html" clicktracking="off">ProxySG Command Line Reference</a></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;"><a href="https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html" clicktracking="off">ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products</a><br><br><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?</span></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;"><br><br></span></strong>Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. <br><br>Regards,<br>Fauzee</p></div><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto; Center.

For the REST API we can only provide the documentation and not the 
scripting for user. 

For feature request this will go to SE team to request to Broadcom.

ticket. For the FR please contact the SE team for more information.

Hi Team,

Please refer below for my answer.

(Q)I wonder if I can do all the actions currently managed through VPM when 
using Proxy through REST API.

For example, is it possible to do detailed settings and Enable/Disable for 
the 100th Rule through API? I wonder if all management is possible through 
REST API even without using VPM.

(A)-You can use this API if you want to access Management Center without 
using the UI or want to trigger Management Center operation without using 
the UI. This REST API has the ability to:

    * Access and raise alerts.
    * View registered devices, device health, and other monitoring
      variables.
    * View jobs and job execution status.
    * Create, edit, schedule, and execute jobs.
    * Show basic device information like version, disk usage, and name of
      device.
    * Manage devices using the device CLI or device scripts.
    * Manage policy, including creating new objects, changing the policy
      content, and installing policy on a device.
    * Manage MC settings, and return system sensors and monitors.

Please refer below KB for more information on REST API.

Management Center REST API
<https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvu8BSUZtKiQ7WgBZVaWbTk4cuivrKzRpsfqaXrINlgEwaQSFmghLPY5udZ6kI2WqxkUtsT1UacMciCbrM-2FeVIY-2Fhdk-2FthjayWSKvz7RZWLJqqOBWmPnfbCakTP9QrLCzMNLjIkY0ZMWalF-2BMEykO62k-3D-CE9_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FGBvyMCIcQO6vqrt3QoTuVDDEjBRLyLldJ-2FNUlzmHDBC1hUzWvu4NfdUX-2FQsRX2qIXA3njRDaK9tUmEoCZThbmeB-2Bxvi8rmN7t-2Fng56rgNiklCuNxrJ-2BSt-2BrllKGE9kvm5MqIPs4nsYyYi01uMGl420lhDkrjobZsHXRomUL9Mls-3D>

(Q)Additionally, you said that you can extract the policy into Excel.

Please tell me how to do that and also answer the question about whether it 
is impossible to insert the policy into Excel.

(A)-Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel 
format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is 
structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and 
MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, 
authentication and access with different format and function, it almost 
impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and 
column. 

-For exporting the policy to Excel format, there already FR for this 
feature, but there is no plan to add this feature for now.

Regard,
Fauzee

      device.

      content, and installing policy on a device.

Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.
Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?

The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or 
integrate with third-party products.

https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3D0Kwu_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FGBvyMCIcQO6vqrt3QoTuVGrbhmWKkv52ofvo1sd79-2FhD5UDR3hFjMoQouSBF4QBGilFaqbtpHmixsMwlkFOiHIzuqXBhsgmc-2BqF9Nu3brKlBV2Om2GigAUPJg9fwLIFo-2FrttxUXWBRZnpvRlzqmWVhpTu0tQh9N3Jt6iW9yyGdc-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo or :8082/policy/"> 
https://u4977512.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.WYHhCPp6dEnKQnDFAdHxvstOJ24sP-2BSQkQkuo8rwTe4-3DnB4e_DDREOZ7NkpbYT4gPFrpV6d5nzaEVRBmZFrnK-2F6XR4ac60Tzz3fuYsZ3QTyhRXZ2FGBvyMCIcQO6vqrt3QoTuVHDCcbED45sEF0VouGoPE-2BSsV24f90g0-2BuOWk91r7f4JHQ17LjaLHngV3peEo6pyZTq72XAs-2B-2BhxkDoesSAtJjHSzLhnG5bY2HA0BvwBmyL9vIHfuYIaW4uAxX3xYyU0xIW0NZ1y4SofhtrPF1WaHrw-3D<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/

WEB VPM?

Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel 
format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is 
structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and 
MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, 
authentication and access with different format and function, it almost 
impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and 
column. 

Regards,
Fauzee

possible in WEB VPM?</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;"> </p><div><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;">Hi Jinyoung Hong,<br><br>Regarding your question please refer below for the answer:<br><br><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Q1) The existing Java VPM has changed to support WEB VPM.</span></strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins;"><br><strong><span style="font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Is it possible to manage via API in WEB VPM?</span></strong></span></p><p>The ProxySG does not have APIs that fetch data from the ProxySG or integrate with third-party products.</p><p>Workaround : </p><p>1. Use the Management Center REST API.</p><p><br>Management Center can connect to the ProxySG to apply changes. </p><p>See the documentation on the REST API: <a title="Management Center REST API" href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/management-center/3-3/api.html" clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off">Management Center REST API</a></p><p> </p><p>2. The ProxySG has a number of read-only advanced URL like <a href="https://<ProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=" clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off"> :8082/sysinfo"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/sysinfo</a> or <a href="https://<ProxySG_IP_address+clicktracking=" clicktracking="off" clicktracking="off"> :8082/policy/"> https://<ProxySG_IP_address>:8082/policy/</a> <br><br>These are not APIs but the URLs can be used to fetch information about the proxy. </p><p> </p><p>3. The ProxySG's SSH interface can be utilized to make changes in the proxy configuration using the CLI. Using SSH it is possible to script commands for automation.. </p><p>Refer to the CLI documentation: <a href="https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/symantec-security-software/web-and-network-security/edge-swg/7-3/index2/_privileged.html" clicktracking="off">ProxySG Command Line Reference</a></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto; mso-margin-bottom-alt: auto;"><a href="https://knowledge.broadcom.com/external/article/206621/proxysg-api-to-gather-data-and-integrate.html" clicktracking="off">ProxySG API to gather data and integrate with other reporting products</a><br><br><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;">Q2) Can't the policy be reflected in Excel format instead of XML format in WEB VPM?</span></strong><strong><span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Poppins; background: white;"><br><br></span></strong>Currently ProxySG do not support the option to export policy to excel format. If you noticed before, in the policy trace, the policy is structured as a line of command which is check one by one with MISS and MATCH status. As ProxySG are built to use multiple layer like forwarding, authentication and access with different format and function, it almost impossible to create a general rule which can fit into Excel row and column. <br><br>Regards,<br>Fauzee</p></div><p class="MsoNormal" style="mso-margin-top-alt: auto;
